sen.j: 勅旨省（ちょくししょう）は日本律令制で奈良時代後期に設置された令外官。
sen.e: Chokushisho was an extra statutory office established in the latter half of the Nara period under the ritsuryo penal and administrative system.
Chokushisho was an extra statutory office established in the latter half of the Nara period under the ritsuryo system.
sen.cmt: ritsuryo penal and administrative system をRitsuryo system に修正しました。
sen.e: Chokushisho was an extra statutory office established in the latter half of the Nara period under the ritsuryo system.

sen.j: 天皇・太上天皇に近侍してその勅旨を奉じて円滑な実施を図るとともに、その家産経営を掌った。
sen.e: Chokushisho attended the emperors and ex-emperors and managed to implement the imperial orders smoothly; it also administered and managed the Imperial estate.
Chokushisho attended the emperors and ex-emperors and managed to implement the imperial orders smoothly; it also administered and managed the Imperial estate.
Chokushisho attended the emperors and ex-emperors and managed to implement the imperial orders smoothly; it also administered and managed the Imperial estate.

sen.j: 孝謙天皇は病気により淳仁天皇に位を譲位したが道鏡の加持祈祷によって回復し積極的に政治に介入するようになった。
sen.e: Emperor Koken abdicated the throne in favor of Emperor Junin because of illness; however, he recovered from the illness due to Buddhist monk Dokyo's prayer and began positively intervening in the Junin Emperor's administration.

Empress Koken abdicated the throne in favor of Emperor Junin because of illness; however, she recovered from the illness due to Buddhist priest Dokyo's prayer and began positively intervening in the Emperor Junin's administration.
sen.cmt: Emperor を Empress に修正しました。he を she に修正しました。monk を priest に修正しました。Junin Emperor's を Emperor Junin's に修正しました。
sen.e: Empress Koken abdicated the throne in favor of Emperor Junin because of illness; however, she recovered from the illness due to Buddhist priest Dokyo's prayer and began positively intervening in the Emperor Junin's administration.

sen.j: これにより上皇側と天皇側が対立し始めた。
sen.e: Gradually, confrontation emerged between Koken and Junin.
Gradually, confrontation emerged between the Retired Empress Koken and the Emperor Junin.
sen.cmt: Koken and Junin をthe Retired Empress Koken and the Emperor Junin に修正しました。※孝謙に関しては「上皇」という記載が原文に無いことからこれを補って訳しました。また、上記の表記に併せて、天皇にも淳仁を補って訳しました。
sen.e: Gradually, confrontation emerged between the Retired Empress Koken and the Emperor Junin.

sen.j: そこで762年に上皇によって勅旨省が設置された。
sen.e: In 762, Koken established Chokushisho.
There the Retired Empress established Chokushisho in 762.
sen.cmt: 「そこで」訳漏れのためThere を追記しました。Koken を the Retired Empress に修正しました。
sen.e: There the Retired Empress established Chokushisho in 762.

sen.j: 勅旨省は上皇の官房機関として働き太政官を介せずに調達を行った。
sen.e: Chokushisho functioned as the ex-emperor's secretariat office, exercised authority over procurement over the head of the Great Council of State.
Chokushisho functioned as the Retired Empress's secretariat office, procured goods and services over the head of the Great Council of State.
sen.cmt: ex-emperor's をRetired Empress's に修正しました。「調達を行った」exercised authority over procurement を procured goods and services に修正しました。
sen.e: Chokushisho functioned as the Retired Empress's secretariat office, procured goods and services over the head of the Great Council of State.

sen.j: 上皇が再び即位した後も機能し続け､道鏡政権の有力な権力機関として存在し続けた。
sen.e: Even after the Koken's second accession to the throne (as Emperor Shotoku), Chokushisho remained, used by Dokyo as his strong power organization.
Even after the Retired Empress ascended the throne again, Chokushisho remained as Dokyo's strong organization.
sen.cmt: 全文修正しました。power を削除しました。
sen.e: Even after the Retired Empress ascended the throne again, Chokushisho remained as Dokyo's strong organization.

sen.j: 光仁天皇が即位した後も規模を縮小しながら調達機関として働いた。
sen.e: After Emperor Konin was enthroned (succeeding to Emperor Shotoku), Chokushisho kept functioning as a procurement office, though the size was reduced.
After Emperor Konin was enthroned (succeeding to Empress Shotoku), Chokushisho kept functioning as a procurement office, though the size was reduced.
sen.cmt: Emperor を Empress に修正しました。
sen.e: After Emperor Konin was enthroned (succeeding to Empress Shotoku), Chokushisho kept functioning as a procurement office, though the size was reduced.

sen.j: 官制については不明な点が多いが、卿・大輔が各1名、少輔・大丞・少丞・大録・少録は各2名の定員であったと考えられている。
sen.e: Regulations for Chokushisho were mostly unknown--It was supposedly staffed by one Kyo, one Taifu, two Sho, two Taijo, two Shojo, two Daisakan, and two Shosakan.

Regulations for Chokushisho were mostly unknown--It was supposedly staffed by one Kyo (Minister), one Taifu (Senior Assistant Minister), two Shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister), two Taijo (Senior Secretary), two Shojo (Junior Secretary), two Daisakan (Senior Recorder), and two Shosakan (Junior Recorder).
sen.cmt: one Kyo, one Taifu, two Sho, two Taijo, two Shojo, two Daisakan, and two Shosakan をone Kyo (Minister), one Taifu (Senior Assistant Minister), two Shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister), two Taijo (Senior Secretary), two Shojo (Junior Secretary), two Daisakan (Senior Recorder), and two Shosakan (Junior Recorder) に修正しました。
sen.e: Regulations for Chokushisho were mostly unknown--It was supposedly staffed by one Kyo (Minister), one Taifu (Senior Assistant Minister), two Shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister), two Taijo (Senior Secretary), two Shojo (Junior Secretary), two Daisakan (Senior Recorder), and two Shosakan (Junior Recorder).

sen.j: なお、記録上唯一勅旨卿として名前が知られているのは、779年に在任中に死去した藤原縄麻呂のみである。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Tadamaro was the only Chokushisho official whose name appears in a record: He served as Chokushi-Kyo and died in 779 during his service.
FUJIWARA no Tadamaro was the only Chokushisho official whose name appears in a record: He served as Chokushi-Kyo and died in 779 during his service.

sen.j: 道鏡政権ではこの他､造宮省・内豎省・法王宮職・造寺司・近衛兵令外官など巨大機関が乱立し朝廷財政を圧迫したため782年に行政改革の一環として廃止され業務は勅旨所に引き継がれた。
sen.e: Under the control of Dokyo, major organizations (Zogusho, Naijusho, Hoogushiki, Zojishi, Konoehei-Ryogekan) were established one after the other, and the Imperial Court became financially hard-pressed--In 782, an administrative reform was carried out and Chokushisho (勅旨省) was abolished, with its business succeeded by Chokushisho (勅旨所).

Under the control of Dokyo, major organizations such as Zogusho (Ministry of Making and Mending Palaces), Nijusho (Ministry of Royal Pages), Hoogushiki (a post of domestic governing institution for Dokyo), Zojishi (officials in charge of building temples), Konoehei-Ryoge no kan (a post outside the original Ritsuryo code created by Imperial edicts) were established one after the other, and that weighed on the Imperial Court financially: In 782, an administrative reform was carried out and Chokushisho was abolished, with its business succeeded by Chokushisho (Imperial Decree Office).

Under the control of Dokyo, major organizations such as Zogusho (Ministry of Making and Mending Palaces), Nijusho (Ministry of Royal Pages), Hoogushiki (a post of domestic governing institution for Dokyo), Zojishi (officials in charge of building temples), Konoehei-Ryoge no kan (a post outside the original Ritsuryo code created by Imperial edicts) were established one after the other, and that weighed on the Imperial Court financially: In 782, an administrative reform was carried out and Chokushisho was abolished, with its business succeeded by Chokushisho (Imperial Decree Office).

sen.j: しかし、やがて蔵人所の設置により業務を奪われて消滅した。
sen.e: Later, Kurodo-dokoro was established and took over the Chokushisho.
Later, Kurodo dokoro (Board of Archivists) was established and took over the Chokushisho.
sen.cmt: Kurodo-dokoro に (Board of Archivists) を追記しました。
sen.e: Later, Kurodo dokoro (Board of Archivists) was established and took over the Chokushisho.

sen.j: この機関は光明皇太后の命令を伝達する紫微中台を模倣したものと考えられている。
sen.e: This organization was considered to have imitated Shibichudai, which transmitted orders from Empress Komyo.
